content: This continuation of the chapter is discussing Virtual Reality and 3D interaction, including positioning in 3D space, moving and grasping, seeing 3D through helmets and caves, as well as various other physical controls, sensors, and special displays. The chapter talks about how 3D displays and VR helmets work, as well as the technology behind them, the problem of VR motion sickness and the ways to improve it. The chapter also discusses simulation and VR caves and various physical controls, such as sound, touch, feel and smell, as well as environmental and bio-sensing, and dedicated displays. The chapter concludes by discussing paper, including printing and scanning technology, fonts, page description, WYSIWYG, scanning, and OCR.
